description:
From Latin fascinare ("to bewitch"), possibly from Ancient Greek βασκαίνιεν (baskaínien, “to speak ill of; to curse”)
Morphologically fascinate +‎ -ion

entries.meaning: (archaic) The act of bewitching, or enchanting
The state or condition of being fascinated.
examples: Sliding down the shaft he lay still, the spear jutting above him its full length, like a horrible stalk growing out of his back.The girl stared down at him in morbid fascination, until Khemsa took her arm and led her through the gate.
Life after death had always been a great fascination to him.
